item.title: Peak Players Running Into Big Issue With New Mesa Update
item.description:
The Peak Mesa update has officially landed, but players immediately encountered a major problem that literally blocked their progression. Reports indicate that invisible walls have been preventing players from proceeding in Peak , ruining their first experiences exploring the new biome.

The Peak Mesa update dropped on August 11, introducing the first new biome to explore since the game launched in June. In addition to the new biome, the Peak update also introduced new badges, items, a bug phobia mode for Mesa, and a number of bug fixes. However, the biggest new feature of the wildly popular co-op game has let down players.

Invisible Wall Prevents Peak Players from Progressing in Mesa

Shortly after the launch of the Mesa update for Peak , reports started coming in of players finding that they couldn't progress in the game. While trying to climb to the top, numerous fans ran into an invisible wall that they couldn't find their way around to complete the area. As one might expect, this was extremely disappointing for the fanbase, especially since most were having this problem near the end of their climb, making all of their progress for naught. Players quickly took to social media to complain, and pinged developer Aggro Crab on platforms like Twitter.

Thankfully, Aggro Crab was extremely responsive to the issue, responding to a player's report within an hour of their tweet, announcing that a fix was in the works. Shortly after, the team sent out a second tweet, alerting players that update 1.21 was now available on Steam and would fix the invisible wall in Mesa. Players who experienced this issue earlier should make sure to install it before booting up the game again.

Some players seem to be frustrated that this bug made it to the official update, pointing out that it should have been caught during QA. It seemed to particularly annoy players since the prior area, the Alpine, has been made inaccessible for the first week following Mesa's release. However, Aggro Crab has done well pushing out a fix as quickly as it did, especially for an indie game developer. Now that the most significant issue has been amended, hopefully players can enjoy Mesa as it's intended to be played with no further hiccups. Those who are still missing Alpine, on the other hand, will be able to play it again soon, as Peak will begin randomly cycling maps between Mesa and Alpine at that point.

item.title: Battlefield 6 Devs Want Players’ Help in Fixing ‘Unexpectedly Fast’ Time to Death Issue
item.description:
Battlefield 6 is asking players for help in fixing an "unexpectedly fast" time-to-death bug. The issue was discovered during the Battlefield 6 open beta, which gave players the chance to play the highly anticipated game that will be released for PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X/S on October 10, 2025.

The first week of the Battlefield 6 beta took place from August 7 to August 10, and set impressive milestones for the series' history. The test made the Siege of Cairo, Liberation Peak, and Iberian Offensive maps available for play, along with five game modes, including the fan-favorite Conquest. While the beta kept the community entertained and engaged, Battlefield 6 did experience some problems, such as a high number of cheaters and a conflict with anti-cheat software that required PC players to uninstall Valorant . The Battlefield 6 testing period presented another problem that the developers are working on addressing.

Battlefield 6 Investigates Unexpectedly Fast Time to Death (TTD) Bug

On Twitter, lead game designer Florian Le Bihan asked players to send videos from the Battlefield 6 open beta that recorded the unexpectedly fast time-to-death problem happening. The tweet has garnered 160 responses so far, many of them with videos and reports. One of the most notable responses shows two situations: one in which the player is instantly knocked out but sees no indication of being hit, and another in which they take damage seconds after being shot. time to death, also known as TTD, refers to the time it takes for a player to die after being hit.

In addition to asking for reports of the unexpectedly fast time to death issue, Florian Le Bihan asked players to show videos in which players are hit by “super bullets.” In addition to these, players can find a comprehensive list of other issues reported during the Battlefield 6 beta on the official Electronic Arts forum. Some situations include players not being able to ping or spot while inside a vehicle, the “close map” button becoming unusable after opening the map in-game, and the Battlefield 6 character being unable to ping enemies while using stationary weapons.

With the Battlefield 6 servers closed, the development team continues to collect feedback from players to make the necessary corrections. After all, Battlefield 6 will return for a second week of open beta, which will begin on August 14 and end on August 17. In addition to having a second chance to test the game, Battlefield 6 players can unlock rewards for participating in the second week: the War Machine vehicle skin, the Bat Company dog tag, and the Striking Distance weapon package.

item.title: Mafia: The Old Country Follows in Starfield's Footsteps, But Not in a Good Way
item.description:
Mafia: The Old Country is now here, and it brings players a drama-filled story drenched in crime and beautiful scenery. While it may not be the most groundbreaking game to launch this year, its strengths make it worth the time. Mafia: The Old Country is an especially strong option for lovers of historical fiction, as the game's setting of early 1900s Sicily is a shining point.

With its historical setting and narrative-driven formula, many wouldn't expect Mafia: The Old Country to have something in common with an open-world sci-fi RPG like Starfield . For the most part, the games are vastly different from one another, but when it comes to loading times, the two share an unfortunate common ground.

Mafia: The Old Country and Starfield Both Struggle With Slow Loading Times

One of Starfield's Most Notorious Problems

Since Starfield launched back in 2023, Bethesda's ambitious space-faring adventure has failed to hit the highs that many were expecting. Criticisms of an empty world and lack of replay value continue to plague the game, and that's made even worse by its painfully slow loading times. Starfield is filled with loading screens, and for a game that is meant to be explored for hours, it quickly grows old. As soon as one gets into the game, a loading screen pops up, killing the momentum.

Bethesda originally planned for Starfield to get annual expansions, but after the mixed reception to its first DLC, Shattered Space , the developer has yet to reveal a second one.

Mafia: The Old Country's Loading Time is an Improvement, But Not By Much

Granted, Mafia: The Old Country 's loading times don't take nearly as long as Starfield 's do, but load points pop up incredibly often throughout the story, which can also end up throwing a wrench in the narrative's momentum. It's fascinating, because these loading screens are frustrating for two different reasons. On the one hand, Starfield 's loading screens make its open world feel as though it's locked in a cage, and on the other hand, Mafia: The Old Country 's loading times keep the story from feeling as smooth as it could.

It's a compelling example of how loading times affect two vastly different games in essentially the same manner. Despite the many ways games have progressed over the years, there are still instances where loading times can keep a good game from becoming a great game, and it's a shame. Mafia: The Old Country 's story is its strongest point, and having to deal with slow loading when one's fully invested in the narrative makes for a frustrating time.

Although the two games share low loading times, they use different engines. Starfield uses Creation Engine 2, while Mafia: The Old Country uses Unreal Engine 5.

Despite its Slow Loading Times, Mafia: The Old Country is Still a Fun Time

Mafia: The Old Country isn't reshaping the landscape of gaming or anything, but it's a strong story with solid, albeit familiar, gameplay. After its modest launch, Mafia: The Old Country will hopefully gain traction over time, because it still has a lot going for it. It's been a long time since the last mainline Mafia game, and the franchise deserves to meet its full potential.

Mafia: The Old Country is an especially strong option for lovers of historical fiction, as the game's setting of early 1900s Sicily is a shining point.

For those who are in search of a solid story with great characters that doesn't overstay its welcome, Mafia: The Old Country is well worth the time. The game may suffer from some performance issues that feel dated at this point, but once one looks past the loading times, there is a fascinating world to dive into.

item.title: Arrowhead Comments on Latest Fortnite Season’s Helldivers 2 Similarities
item.description:
The CEO of Arrowhead Game Studios and one of its community managers have recently commented on the similarities between Helldivers 2 and Fortnite Chapter 6 Season 4. Though many fans have brought up concerns that Fortnite might be muscling in on its turf, Helldivers 2 is “not worried” about it, and asserts that “there is room for us all at the king’s table.”

Fortnite just kicked off Chapter 6 Season 4, Shock N’ Awesome, on August 7, which introduced new weapons, skins, a refresh of the Battle Pass, and a game-changing map mechanic: Bug Invasions. Many gamers could not help but notice that this particular aspect of the new season of Fortnite seemed similar to Helldivers 2 – the extraction shooter that prominently features the insectoid Terminids as one of the main enemy factions.

‘Feels Very Democratic’ – Helldivers 2 on Fortnite’s Bugs

Players aren’t the only ones who noticed this similarity. On the official Helldivers 2 Discord, Arrowhead community manager Katherine Baskin commented on the newly-released Fortnite content, saying, “it's giving 'we have Helldivers at home’.” However, she went on to clarify that it was actually more flattering than anything, and that the studio is not worried about the competition. " Fortnite is Fortnite , Helldivers is Helldivers ,” she said. “If the kings of video game drip think our drip is cool enough to... inspire them... then that's super cool. But our games couldn't be more different from one another. There's room for us all at the king's table."

Helldivers 2 CEO Shams Jorjani also commented on the new Fortnite season, saying it “feels very democratic” – a tongue-in-cheek reference to the setting of Helldivers 2 . That said, Jorjani also admitted he did not play Fortnite or any other shooters besides Helldivers 2 and Battlefield , though he tries to make time for other types of games, like Magic: The Gathering , Subnautica , and Baldur’s Gate 3 .

Fortnite is Fortnite , Helldivers is Helldivers. If the kings of video game drip think our drip is cool enough to... inspire them... then that's super cool. But our games couldn't be more different from one another. There's room for us all at the king's table.

This is far from the first game that Fortnite has taken inspiration from, and it will not be the last. The incredibly popular battle royale has featured references, both direct and indirect, to tons of pop culture staples and icons, such as past and rumored future Fortnite x Avatar: The Last Airbender collabs or its many Star Wars crossovers. What’s more, the iconic clash of human marines and alien bugs featured in Helldivers 2 is even a reference to older sci-fi works, such as the Arachnids of Starship Troopers and the Zerg of StarCraft , which are themselves callbacks to the Tyranids of Warhammer 40,000 .

Either way, both Fortnite and Helldivers 2 are doing exceptionally well. Over 250 million Bugs were taken down in Fortnite within the first few days of the new season, and Helldivers 2 is gearing up for its Xbox Series X|S platform release on August 26. Needless to say, it seems like there are enough soldiers out there to push back the Bugs in both Helldivers 2 and Fortnite simultaneously.

Do you believe in freedom? Can you stand in the face of oppression – and defend the defenceless? Wage war for peace. Die for democracy.
Join forces with up to three friends and wreak havoc on an alien scourge threatening the safety of your home planet, Super Earth, in this multiplayer co-op shooter for PS5 and PC from Arrowhead Game Studios.
Step into the boots of the Helldivers, an elite class of soldiers whose mission is to spread peace, liberty and Managed Democracy using the biggest, baddest and most explosive tools in the galaxy.
Helldivers don't go planet side without proper backup, but it’s up to you to decide how and when to call it in. Not only do you have a host of superpowered primary weapons and customizable loadouts, you also have the ability to call on stratagems during play.
Helldivers 2 features Arrowhead's best cooperative gameplay yet. Collaboration will be vital: Teams will synergize on loadouts, strategize their approach for each mission and complete objectives together.1
Enlist in Super Earth’s premier military peacekeeping force today. We are heroes… we are legends… WE ARE HELLDIVERS.

item.title: All Madden NFL 26 Rookie Dev Traits
item.description:
A new year means a new set of rookies in Madden NFL 26 , and this year's rookie class has some promising talent with strong development traits. Development traits in Madden NFL 26 determine a rookie player's growth potential, so it's worth focusing on the rookies with the best traits.

Not counting the normal option that most rookies have, there are three development traits that a player can have: Star, Superstar, and X-Factor. Depending on a player's development trait, they'll require less XP to gain skill points and be able to equip Superstar or X-Factor abilities to enhance their gameplay on the field. These are all the rookie development traits this year in Madden NFL 26 .

Madden NFL 26 Rookie Dev Traits

These are the Star, Superstar, and X-Factor rookies in Madden NFL 26 .
